Chinese:
等一下！
握手！
還沒！

English:
Oh, boy. You really ARE new at this. Do you intend
to face off against a Digital Monster unarmed?
Chinese:
真是初生之犢不畏虎……。
你想要徒手挑戰數碼寶貝嗎？
Korean:
정말이지, 터무니없는 "알"이군…
디지털 "몬스터"에게, 맨주먹으로 맞설 생각인가?
German:
Oha. Du bist WIRKLICH noch neu. Willst du dich
unbewaffnet einem digitalen Monster stellen?

English: No... You're just a soft touch. That's it.
German: Nein ... Nur ein wenig zart besaitet. Das ist es.

English:
What a coincidence. I am both those things as 
well. Just this once, allow me to aid you.
Chinese:
真巧……我也是個好事者加爛好人，
我就破例借你力量吧。
Korean:
우연이네… 나도 그런대로 유별나고, 사람이 좋거든
특별히 힘을 빌려주지
German:
So ein Zufall. Auch ich habe diese beiden
Eigenschaften. Erlaube mir, dir ausnahmsweise
zu helfen.

English: You, um, needn't do anything for the moment.
Chinese: 你可以什麼事都不用做。
German: Du musst, äh, vorerst gar nichts tun.

English:
Watch and learn. This is how a real hacker uses
their skills.
Chinese: 只要在一旁看著就好……看看我至高榮譽的駭客之力。
Korean: 그냥 보고 있어… 긍지높은 해커의 힘을
German:
Schau gut zu. So verwendet ein echter
Hacker seine Fähigkeiten.

English: Well, it seems it wants to fight alongside you.
Chinese: 看來它打算和你一起戰鬥。
German:
Nun, es scheint an deiner Seite kämpfen zu
wollen.

English:
It may have been something of an ordeal, but that 
Digimon is now yours. Instruct it well, and master
the program.
Chinese:
雖然完全沒有按照步驟走，但這隻數碼寶貝是你的了。
你要確實下達指令，熟練這個程式。
Korean:
꽤나 순서가 꼬였지만… 그 디지몬은 네 거야
확실히 지시를 내리면서 프로그램을 다루도록 해
German:
Das war vielleicht etwas mühselig, aber nun
gehört das Digimon dir. Trainiere es gut
und meistere das Programm.
